oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. John N. Warlick to his wife
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Pvt. John N. Warlick, Co. G, 55th Tenn. Vol. Inf. Regt., CSA, to his wife Nancy, written days after his capture on Island No. 10 and imprisonment at Camp Chase, Ohio. He assures his wife he is well and in "comfortable quarters." Of the 55th's surrender, he writes, "We surrendered on the 7th without the fire of a gun. If we had a fight then been taken It would have been different but it is so and I am prisoner of war."
